title: [$250] Update ECard `willBeReady` text to be dynamic

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Problem When issuing a physical ECard as an admin, the subheader text always reads `This card will be ready to use immediately.`. This does not make sense in the context of a physical card, which must be ordered and shipped before it can be used. ## Solution I confirmed the text is hardcoded in the translation `workspace.card.issueNewCard.willBeReady` which is used in `src/pages/workspace/expensifyCard/issueNew/ConfirmationStep.tsx`. The solution here is to make the text dynamic. Specifically, if the admin is issuing a physical card, the text should read `This card will be ready to ship immediately.` (Uses `ship` instead of `use`.)

title: Clean up SettlementButton

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78915...

### Problem
The SettlementButton component is quite complex (and important!), and I struggled to review changes made to part of it due to its complexity.

### Solution
Let's clean up this important component! In order:

1. Add automated UI tests covering the business logic for this component. `customText` and `secondLineText` alone have many permutations of conditions and expected results. These can be captured and documented by automated tests, which will help developers understand this component and more confidently make changes.
1. Remove manual memoization to make it compile with React Compiler. There are 25 instances of this warning:

  ```
  This component hasn't been memoized by React Compiler.
  Reason: Existing memoization could not be preserved
  ```
  
  This manual memoization is making the component more complex and longer.

1. (exploration needed) Break it down into smaller, distinct components (by report type?) (i.e: using composition). It looks like there's significant differences in behavior for invoices vs expense reports vs IOU reports. Rather than having all three wrapped up in one component, let's DRY the common parts into a shared hook and keep the other parts separate, using the correct component for each type.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.99-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69326 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjkdsnsndoisjoidsjdoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Click + > Create expense > Scan. 4. Upload two receipts. 5. On confirm page, click on the receipt. 6. Click 3-dot menu > Replace. 7. Replace the receipt. BUG 1: The second receipt disappears after replacing the first receipt. 8. Close the RHP. 9. Click + > Create expense > Scan. 10. Upload two receipts. 11. On confirm page, click next arrow on the top right to navigate to the second receipt. 12. Click on the receipt. 13. Click 3-dot menu > Replace. 14. Replace the receipt. BUG 2: To field disappears. Amount field changes to 0.00. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: After replacing the first receipt, the second receipt should remain unaffected. BUG 2: After replacing the second receipt, To field will not disappear. Amount field will not show up because this is a scan expense. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: The second receipt disappears after replacing the first receipt. BUG 2: After replacing the second receipt, To field disappears, Amount field changes to 0.00. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8160d276-5b0a-4c68-9fe8-92ae14038dee [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Launch Hybrid app 2. Click FAB > Scan > Enable multiple scan 3. Capture multiple receipts or images (around 3-4) 4. Click on the last receipt preview 5. Click left navigation arrow to open 3rd receipt 6. Click on the delete icon >> delete 7. Observe last receipt/image (4th one) gets deleted 8. Repeat steps 4-6 selecting 2nd receipt and observe 3rd gets deleted ## Expected Result: Selected receipt/image should get deleted ## Actual Result: Wrong receipt/image gets deleted in multiple scan flow. title: [$125] Increase HitSlop on checkboxes

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1768001018554839 ### Problem When clicking on checkboxes, for example, on the category list to bulk-delete categories, I'm finding it really easy to accidentally miss the checkbox and open the category details by mistake. ### Solution Increase the HitSlop on the checkbox to prettymuch take up all the space to left of the category name. If you wanted to click on the row, you'd not be clicking so near the checkbox.
